00038 #ifndef _GNSS_RXDATA_H_
00039 #define _GNSS_RXDATA_H_
00040 
00041 #include <stdio.h>
00042 #include "GNSS_Types.h"
00043 #include "gps.h"
00044 
00045 
00046 /// This is the fixed number of channels contained in the array 
00047 /// for one GNSS_RxData object.
00048 #define GNSS_RXDATA_NR_CHANNELS (48)
00049 
00050 /// This is the buffer length (in bytes) for a data message buffer used
00051 /// by the receiver object in decoding data.
00052 #define GNSS_RXDATA_MSG_LENGTH  (16384)
00053 
00054 
00055 namespace GNSS
00056 {
00057   //============================================================================
00058   /// \class   GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray
00059   /// \brief   An array class for storing broadcast GPS ephemeris and almanac 
00060   ///          information.
00061   ///
00062   /// Each satellite is uniquely identified in GPS by it's PRN. Each PRN has
00063   /// an associated almanac structure, a most recent ephemeris structure,
00064   /// and a previous ephemeris structure (to faciliate ephemeris matching)
00065   /// 
00066   /// GPS         are  1-32    \n
00067   /// Pseudolites are  33-37   \n
00068   /// SBAS        are  120-138 \n
00069   /// WAAS, EGNOS, MSAS        \n
00070   ///
00071   /// WAAS: \n
00072   /// AOR-W       122 \n
00073   /// Anik        138 \n
00074   /// POR         134 \n
00075   /// PanAm       135 \n
00076   ///
00077   /// EGNOS: \n
00078   /// AOR-E       120 \n
00079   /// Artemis     124 \n
00080   /// IOR-W       126 \n
00081   /// IOR-E       131 \n
00082   ///
00083   /// MSAS: \n
00084   /// MTSAT-1     129 \n
00085   /// MTSAT-2     137 \n
00086   ///
00087   /// The index mapping is as follows:                      \n
00088   /// PRN 1-37    maps to indidex 0-36                      \n
00089   /// PRN 38-40   maps to indices 37-39 (reserved mappings) \n
00090   /// PRN 120-138 maps to indicex 40-58                     \n
00091   ///
00092   /// \author  Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00093   /// \date    2007-10-29
00094   /// \since   2006-11-15
00095   ///
00096   class GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray
00097   {
00098   public:
00099 
00100     /// \brief    The default constructor (no data allocated yet).
00101     GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray();
00102 
00103     /// \brief    The destructor.
00104     virtual ~GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray();
00105 
00106     /// \brief    Add an ephemeris structure.
00107     /// \return   true if successful, false if error.
00108     bool AddEphemeris( const unsigned short prn, const GPS_structEphemeris &eph );
00109 
00110     /// \brief    Add an almanac structure.
00111     /// \return   true if successful, false if error.
00112     bool AddAlmanac( const unsigned short prn, const GPS_structAlmanac &alm );
00113 
00114 
00115     /// \brief    Check if ephemeris information is available for a PRN.
00116     /// \return   true if successful, false if error.    
00117     bool IsEphemerisAvailable( 
00118       const unsigned short prn, //!< The desired GPS PRN. (1-32 GPS, 120-138 SBAS).
00119       bool &isAvailable,        //!< This boolean indicates if ephemeris data is available or not.
00120       char iode = -1            //!< The issue of data for the ephemeris, -1 means get the most current.
00121       );
00122 
00123     /// \brief    Try to get the most current ephemeris or the ephemeris 
00124     ///           with the issue of data (ephemeris), iode, specified. 
00125     /// \remarks  (1) iode == -1, means retrieve the most current ephemeris. \n
00126     ///           (2) 
00127     /// \return   true if successful, false if error.
00128     bool GetEphemeris( 
00129       const unsigned short prn, //!< The desired GPS PRN. (1-32 GPS, 120-138 SBAS).
00130       GPS_structEphemeris &eph, //!< A reference to an ephemeris struct in which to store the data.
00131       bool &isAvailable,        //!< This boolean indicates if ephemeris data is available or not.
00132       char iode = -1            //!< The issue of data for the ephemeris, -1 means get the most current.
00133       );
00134 
00135   private:
00136     /// \brief   The copy constructor. Disabled!
00137     GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray( const GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray& rhs );
00138 
00139     /// \brief   The assignment operator. Disabled!
00140     void operator=(const GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray& rhs)
00141     {}
00142 
00143   protected:
00144 
00145     /// \brief   Allocate the array.
00146     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.
00147     bool AllocateArray();
00148 
00149     /// \brief   Get the index of the PRN in the array.
00150     /// \return  true if successful, false if error (e.g. unsupported PRN).
00151     bool GetIndexGivenPRN( const unsigned short prn, unsigned short &index );
00152 
00153   protected:
00154 
00155     struct GPS_structOrbitParameters
00156     {
00157       unsigned short prn;
00158       GPS_structEphemeris currentEph;
00159       GPS_structEphemeris previousEph;
00160       GPS_structAlmanac   almanac;
00161     };
00162 
00163     /// A pointer to the array of GPS satellite orbit information structs.
00164     GPS_structOrbitParameters* m_array; 
00165 
00166     /// The maximum number of elements in m_array.
00167     unsigned m_arrayLength;
00168   };
00169

00171   //============================================================================
00172   /// \class   GNSS_RxData
00173   /// \brief   A class for handling GNSS information for ONE EPOCH for ONE
00174   ///          RECEIVER such as pseudorange, ADR, and Doppler measurements, 
00175   ///          user position, user velocity, and other associated information.
00176   ///          The previous epoch of data is also retained if available.
00177   /// 
00178   /// The 'measurement' data is public and can be accessed directly by the user! 
00179   /// This is struct style encapsulation and to allow easy access to the data but
00180   /// the user must be careful (especially with the observation array in to 
00181   /// avoiding out of bound array access).
00182   ///
00183   /// \author  Glenn D. MacGougan (GDM)
00184   /// \date    2007-10-29  
00185   /// \since   2006-11-13
00186   /// 
00187   class GNSS_RxData
00188   { 
00189   public: // types
00190 
00191     /// \brief    These are the supported receiver data types.
00192     enum GNSS_enumRxDataType
00193     {
00194       GNSS_RXDATA_NOVATELOEM4 = 0,
00195       GNSS_RXDATA_UNKNOWN
00196     };
00197     
00198   public: 
00199 
00200     /// \brief    The default constructor (no data allocated yet).
00201     GNSS_RxData();                                             
00202 
00203     /// \brief    The destructor.
00204     virtual ~GNSS_RxData();
00205 
00206   private:
00207 
00208     /// \brief   The copy constructor. Disabled!
00209     GNSS_RxData( const GNSS_RxData& rhs );
00210 
00211     /// \brief   The assignment operator. Disabled!
00212     GNSS_RxData& operator=(const GNSS_RxData& rhs)
00213     { return *this; }
00214 
00215   public: 
00216 
00217     /// \brief   Set all data in the measurement array to zero.
00218     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.    
00219     bool ZeroAllMeasurements();
00220 
00221 
00222     /// \brief   Set all PVT data to zero.
00223     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.        
00224     bool ZeroPVT();
00225 
00226 
00227     /// \brief   Set the initial receiver position, velocity, and time.
00228     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.        
00229     bool SetInitialPVT( 
00230       const double latitudeRads,   //!< The latitude [rad].
00231       const double longitudeRads,  //!< The longitude [rad].
00232       const double height,         //!< The orthometric height [m].
00233       const double vn,             //!< The northing velocity [m/s].
00234       const double ve,             //!< The easting velocity [m/s].
00235       const double vup,            //!< The up velocity [m/s].
00236       const double clk,            //!< The clock offset [m].
00237       const double clkdrift,       //!< The clock drift [m/s].
00238       const double std_lat,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the latitude [m].
00239       const double std_lon,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the longitude [m].
00240       const double std_hgt,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the height [m].
00241       const double std_vn,         //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the northing velocity [m/s].
00242       const double std_ve,         //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the easting velocity [m/s].
00243       const double std_vup,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the up velocity [m/s].
00244       const double std_clk,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the clock offset [m].
00245       const double std_clkdrift,   //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the clock drift [m/s].
00246       const double undulation = 0  //!< The undulation if known [m].
00247       );
00248 
00249     /// \brief   Update the receiver position and clock offset.
00250     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.            
00251     bool UpdatePositionAndRxClock( 
00252       const double latitudeRads,   //!< The latitude [rad].
00253       const double longitudeRads,  //!< The longitude [rad].
00254       const double height,         //!< The orthometric height [m].
00255       const double clk,            //!< The clock offset [m].
00256       const double std_lat,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the latitude [m].
00257       const double std_lon,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the longitude [m].
00258       const double std_hgt,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the height [m].
00259       const double std_clk         //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the clock offset [m].
00260       );
00261 
00262     /// \brief   Update the receiver velocity and clock drift.
00263     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.                
00264     bool UpdateVelocityAndClockDrift( 
00265       const double vn,             //!< The northing velocity [m/s].
00266       const double ve,             //!< The easting velocity [m/s].
00267       const double vup,            //!< The up velocity [m/s].
00268       const double clkdrift,       //!< The clock drift [m/s].
00269       const double std_vn,         //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the northing velocity [m/s].
00270       const double std_ve,         //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the easting velocity [m/s].
00271       const double std_vup,        //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the up velocity [m/s].
00272       const double std_clkdrift    //!< The standard deviation uncertainty in the clock drift [m/s].
00273       );
00274 
00275 
00276   
00277     /// \brief  Get degrees, minutes, seconds from a decimal degrees angle.
00278     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.        
00279     static bool GetDMS( 
00280       const double angleDegs,  //!< The angle [degrees].
00281       short &degrees,          //!< The degrees part.
00282       short &minutes,          //!< The minutes part.
00283       float &seconds,          //!< The seconds part.
00284       char *dms_str,           //!< A DMS string e.g. dms_str = "-180'59'59.9999\""
00285       const unsigned maxLength_dms_str //!< The maximum length of the dms_str string.
00286       );
00287   
00288 
00289 
00290 
00291     /// \brief   Initialize the source of measurements 
00292     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.
00293     bool Initialize( const char* path, bool &isValidPath, const GNSS_enumRxDataType rxType );
00294 
00295 
00296     /// \brief   Load the next epoch of data.
00297     /// \return  true if successful, false if error.
00298     /// \param   endOfStream - indicates if the end of the input source 
00299     ///          was reached and no further data is available.
00300     bool LoadNext( bool &endOfStream );
00301 
00302 
00303     /// \brief  Check for cycle slips using the phase rate prediction method.
00304     ///
00305     /// \post   m_ObsArray[i].flags.isNoCycleSlipDetected is set for each observation.
00306     ///
00307     /// \return true if successful, false if error.
00308     bool CheckForCycleSlips_UsingPhaseRatePrediction( 
00309       const double nrThresholdCycles //!< The maximum number of cycles to use as the threshold to detect a slip [cycles].
00310       );
00311 
00312 
00313     /// \brief  A debugging function for printing all of the observation array
00314     /// to a file.
00315     ///
00316     /// \return true if successful, false if error.
00317     bool DebugPrintObservationArray( const char *filepath );
00318 
00319 
00320     bool Debug_WriteSuperMsg80CharsWide(
00321       char* buffer,                    //!< A large character buffer (8KB min).
00322       const unsigned maxBufferLength,  //!< The maximum buffer length [bytes].
00323       const double referenceLatitude,  //!< Reference position latitude [rad].
00324       const double referenceLongitude, //!< Reference position longitude [rad].
00325       const double referenceHeight,    //!< Reference position height [m].
00326       unsigned& nrBytesInBuffer );      //!< The number of bytes set in the buffer.  
00327   
00328   public:
00329 
00330     /// The array of GNSS measurements.
00331     GNSS_structMeasurement m_ObsArray[GNSS_RXDATA_NR_CHANNELS];
00332     
00333     /// The number of usable items in m_ObsArray.
00334     unsigned char m_nrValidObs;
00335 
00336 
00337     /// The previous observation set.
00338     GNSS_structMeasurement m_prev_ObsArray[GNSS_RXDATA_NR_CHANNELS];
00339 
00340     /// The number of usable items in m_prevObsArray.
00341     unsigned char m_prev_nrValidObs;
00342 
00343     
00344     /// The number of GPS L1 observations in m_ObsArray.
00345     unsigned char m_nrGPSL1Obs;
00346 
00347     /// The receiver's position, velocity, and time information.
00348     GNSS_structPVT  m_pvt;
00349 
00350     /// The receiver's previous position, velocity, and time information.
00351     GNSS_structPVT  m_prev_pvt;
00352 
00353     /// The klobuchar ionospheric correction parameters for GPS.
00354     GNSS_structKlobuchar m_klobuchar;
00355 
00356     /// This is an object for storing and handling GPS ephemeris and almanac
00357     /// information for valid GPS system satellites.
00358     GPS_BroadcastEphemerisAndAlmanacArray  m_EphAlmArray;
00359 
00360     /// This is the elevation mask angle [rads]. 
00361     /// The default is 5 degrees.
00362     double m_elevationMask; 
00363 
00364     /// This is the carrier to noise density ratio mask value [dB-Hz].
00365     /// The default is 28.0 dB-Hz.
00366     double m_cnoMask;
00367 
00368     /// This is the minimum allowable locktime [s].
00369     /// The default is 0.0.
00370     double m_locktimeMask;
00371 
00372     /// The maximum usable age for an ephemeris [s].
00373     /// The default is 4 hours (3600*4).
00374     unsigned m_maxAgeEphemeris; 
00375 
00376 
00377     /// A boolean to indicate if the tropospheric correction is to be disabled for all satellites.
00378     bool m_DisableTropoCorrection;
00379 
00380     /// A boolean to indicate if the ionospheric correction is to be disabled for all satellites.
00381     bool m_DisableIonoCorrection;
00382 
00383   protected:
00384 
00385     /// A file pointer to the input.
00386     FILE* m_fid;
00387 
00388     /// A large message buffer.
00389     unsigned char m_message[GNSS_RXDATA_MSG_LENGTH];
00390 
00391     /// The length of the message in the message buffer.
00392     unsigned short m_messageLength;
00393 
00394     /// The receiver data type.
00395     GNSS_enumRxDataType m_rxDataType;
00396     
00397   };
00398 
00399 } // end namespace GNSS
